forumNotes.author: dencorso
forumNotes.content:
![Posted Image](http://reboot.pro/index.php?app=downloads&module=display&section=screenshot&id=175)
**File Name** : grub4dos  
**File Submitter** : [dencorso](http://reboot.pro/user/15622-dencorso/ "")  
**File Submitted** : 31 Mar 2012  
**File Category** : [Boot tools](http://reboot.pro/files/category/7-boot-tools/ "")  

This is the de-facto standard version of grub4dos (0.4.4-2009-10-16), which has become difficult to get after nufans.net demise.  

[Click here to download this file](http://reboot.pro/files/file/175-grub4dos/ "")

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> This is the de-facto standard version of grub4dos, which has become difficult to get after nufans.net demise.  
>
Well, not really.  

It is the only reliable version of 0.4.4, the 2009-10-16 ![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif) (as opposed to the much more "popular" version 0.4.4 2009-03-29 which was buggy) .  

Nowadays latest 0.4.5 is advised.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.content:
The latest versions are here and are much better

I'd have posted the source archive for it (*viz* . grub4dos-0.4.4-2009-10-16) too... But it turns out I don't have it anymore ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png)  
If anyone has an archival copy of it and can be so kind as to post it here, I'd appreciate it very much.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Just curious - Why would you want a 2 year old version when chenall has latest version + source and it is much better and has more features and commands?

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I'd have posted the source archive for it too... But it turns out I don't have it anymore ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png)  
> If anyone has an archival copy of it and can be so kind as to post it here, I'd appreciate it very much.  
Source of what? ![:w00t:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/w00t.gif)  
It's a few years I am fighting this personal battle about ALWAYS specifying the version AND the date of ANY grub4dos reference, and this is what I get? "it" ![:frusty:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/frusty.gif)  

@steve6375  
The other battle that I fight (and that I evidently lose on a daily base ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png)) is to try and explain people how "latest" not necessarily means "better" (and not in \*every\* context).  
As an example, the difference between 285507 and 237849 is 47658 bytes, there may be situations in which these few Kb make a difference.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
> As an example, the difference between 285507 and 237849 is 47658 bytes, there may be situations in which these few Kb make a difference.  
A lot of bytes are taken up by the help text for all the new commands and features...
